; Concerning Your Bad Credit Loan Rate ;
;
;Even though those with poor credit ratings usually face higher interest rates and associated fees on bad credit loans, there is still a ceiling on what much a lender of any sort can charge you simply using a points system. A point in the financial world means a fee charged to your principal or initial financial loan amount, usually equal to 1% with the principal. Borrowers with good credit typically have their points waived, thus making their financial loans almost interest free or with low interest. Those with less than perfect credit are generally charged four to five points for a loan. Check with your local consumer protection office to uncover how many points you will be charged on a loan in your situation, as this varies from state to convey.
